item.title: Urinary tract infections are common in women, say doctors - The Hindu
item.description:
Urinary tract infections are common in women, say doctors

Date: December 22, 2024 08:30 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

Urinary Tract Infection (UTI) is prevalent among women, with many experiencing their first episode by age 25. Contrary to popular belief, UTIs are often due to infrequent bladder emptying rather than unsanitary toilets.

  • One in three women may experience a UTI before turning 25.
  • 18% of pregnant women encounter UTIs, often linked to hormonal changes.
  • Recurrent UTIs are common in healthy, non-pregnant women.
  • Improper urine collection methods can hinder accurate diagnosis.
  • Antibiotic misuse during the COVID-19 pandemic has led to complications.
“During COVID-19 pandemic, antibiotic misuse caused severe problems.” - Ganesh Gopalkrishnan

item.title: Silent threats of calcium deficiency women face - The Times of India
item.description:
Silent Threats of Calcium Deficiency in Women

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

Calcium deficiency poses significant health risks for women, impacting bone density and overall well-being. This article explores these silent threats and emphasizes the importance of adequate calcium intake.

  • Calcium is essential for maintaining bone health and preventing osteoporosis.
  • Women are at a higher risk of calcium deficiency, especially during certain life stages.
  • Dietary sources of calcium should be prioritized over supplements when possible.
"Calcium is essential for maintaining bone health and preventing osteoporosis."

Women must prioritize their calcium intake to prevent severe health consequences related to bone density loss.

item.title: 7 Diet Tips To Boost Immunity This Winter - NDTV Food
item.description:
7 Diet Tips to Boost Immunity This Winter

By: Neha Grover
Image Credit: Getty

This article provides seven dietary tips that can help enhance your immune system during the winter season. From staying hydrated to incorporating certain foods, these tips are easy to implement.

  • Stay Hydrated: Drink plenty of water, herbal teas, and soups.
  • Include Citrus Fruits: Oranges, lemons, and grapefruits are rich in vitamin C.
  • Eat More Garlic: Garlic boosts immunity and reduces cold severity.
  • Include Probiotics: Foods like yoghurt promote gut health.
  • Zinc-Rich Foods: Nuts, seeds, and lean meats are crucial for immune function.
  • Eat Leafy Greens: Spinach and kale help reduce inflammation.
  • Add Spices Like Turmeric: Curcumin in turmeric strengthens immunity.
"Hydration helps your body fight infections and keeps your immune system functioning optimally."

By following these dietary recommendations, individuals can potentially boost their immunity, helping them remain healthy throughout the winter months.

item.title: 20-minute yoga asana routine for women in 30s - The Times of India
item.description:
20-Minute Yoga Asana Routine for Women in Their 30s

Publication Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Times of India

Discover a concise 20-minute yoga routine designed specifically for women in their 30s to enhance strength, flexibility, and mindfulness.

  • Kickstart with centering and breathing exercises (2 minutes).
  • Warm-up poses to release tension (3 minutes).
  • Surya Namaskar and energizing poses (5 minutes).
  • Strength-building poses to enhance core stability (5 minutes).
  • Hip openers to improve flexibility (4 minutes).
  • Cool down and relaxation to integrate benefits (6 minutes).
“Regular practice can help improve physical strength, flexibility, and emotional balance. Commit to this sequence daily or a few times a week.”

This routine not only supports physical well-being but also contributes to the hormonal balance and overall energy levels of women in their 30s.

item.title: From AI training to cold therapy: Here are 5 fitness trends that went viral in 2024 - Indiatimes.com
item.description:
5 Viral Fitness Trends of 2024

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Indiatimes

The fitness world is witnessing innovative trends that combine technology, personalisation, and holistic health. This article highlights five fitness trends that gained popularity in 2024.

  • AI-personal training: Virtual training assistance through AI-powered fitness apps.
  • Ultra-niche fitness: High-intensity, minimal-time workouts gaining traction.
  • Cold therapy: Popular among celebrities for muscle recovery and inflammation reduction.
  • Mindful workouts: Practices like yoga and pilates focusing on mental and physical health.
  • Advanced wearable technology: Fitness trackers with features monitoring various health metrics.
“To stay updated on the stories that are going viral follow Indiatimes Trending.”

The fitness landscape is evolving with a blend of technology and wellness, influencing workouts and recovery methods in profound ways.

item.title: Doctor Explains Impact Of Winter On Mental Health And Ways To Combat Seasonal Affective Disorder - Jagran English
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Harvard University shares 7 tips to keep your memory sharp at any age - Hindustan Times
item.description:
7 Tips from Harvard University to Improve Memory at Any Age

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

As we age, keeping our memory sharp can become a challenge. Harvard University has provided seven tips to help individuals maintain and enhance their memory regardless of their age.

  • Keep Learning: Engaging in continuous education can help keep the brain active.
  • Use All Your Senses: Involve multiple senses during learning for better retention.
  • Believe in Yourself: Positive self-belief can aid memory improvement.
  • Economize Your Brain Use: Organize everyday items to avoid cluttering your memory.
  • Repeat What You Want to Know: Reinforce memory by repeating information aloud or in writing.
  • Space It Out: Use spaced repetition at intervals to enhance memory retention.
  • Make a Mnemonic: Use creative mnemonics for easier recall of information.
"Engaging the whole brain through varied learning strategies enhances memory retention."

By incorporating these tips into daily routines, individuals can enhance their cognitive ability and maintain sharper memories as they age.

item.title: Planning to remove the tonsils surgically? Here's what you should know about the impacts - The Times of India
item.description:
What You Should Know About Tonsil Removal Surgery and Its Impacts

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

Each year, over 500,000 tonsillectomies are performed in the United States, particularly in children, to improve breathing and reduce infections. A recent study published in JAMA Network Open indicates that this common procedure may increase the risk of anxiety disorders later in life.

  • The study analyzed data from over a million individuals in a Swedish health registry.
  • Tonsillectomy linked to a 43% increased risk of developing PTSD, depression, or anxiety.
  • Increased risk persists more than 20 years post-surgery.
  • Tonsils play a role in fighting infection, and their removal may leave the body more vulnerable.
  • The findings necessitate further studies to explore the relationship between tonsil removal and mental health outcomes.
“These findings suggest a potential role of adenotonsillar diseases or associated health conditions in the development of stress-related disorders.”

As surgery becomes a common choice, it’s crucial to weigh both immediate health benefits and potential long-term mental health impacts.

item.title: 9 herbs to treat acne as well as blemishes in no time - Health shots
item.description:
9 Herbs to Treat Acne as Well as Blemishes in No Time

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: Health Shots

This article discusses the use of herbs for treating acne and blemishes. It explores various natural remedies that can help reduce breakouts, restore hydration, and prevent future eruptions.

Key Points:

  • Acne occurs due to blocked pores and can be exacerbated by hormonal changes, diet, and stress.
  • Herbs such as Neem, Aloe Vera, and Tea Tree Oil have antibacterial and anti-inflammatory properties.
  • Regular use of these herbs in appropriate amounts can lead to healthier skin.
“Overuse or wrong application of a few herbs may cause dryness, inflammation, or blocking of pores.” - Dr. Kuri

In conclusion, incorporating herbs into skincare routines can be an effective way to combat acne, but caution must be exercised to avoid potential side effects.

item.title: 8 simple ways to manage your blood pressure during winter - The Times of India
item.description:
8 Simple Ways to Manage Your Blood Pressure During Winter

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

As winter sets in, managing blood pressure becomes crucial for many individuals. The article outlines practical tips to maintain healthy levels despite seasonal challenges.

  • Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water.
  • Incorporate potassium-rich foods into your diet.
  • Engage in regular physical activity, even indoors.
  • Monitor your blood pressure regularly at home.
  • Dress warmly to prevent stress on the heart.
  • Avoid excessive alcohol consumption.
  • Prioritize sleep to support overall health.
  • Consult with your healthcare provider for personalized advice.
"Maintaining blood pressure is essential, especially during winter when risk factors can increase."

In conclusion, taking these steps can support heart health and prevent hypertension complications throughout the colder months.

item.title: Top 5 Ways To Manage Blood Sugar This Festive Season - TheHealthSite
item.description:
Top 5 Ways To Manage Blood Sugar This Festive Season

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: The Health Site

The festive season poses challenges for those managing blood sugar, but you can embrace festivities while prioritizing health through mindful choices.

  • Practice portion control to manage intake of festive treats.
  • Balance with fiber and protein before indulging in sweets.
  • Stay active with short movement sessions after meals to stabilize glucose levels.
  • Stay hydrated and limit sugary beverages to avoid spikes in blood sugar.
  • Adopt mindful eating practices and choose low-glycemic foods.
"You can balance your blood sugar throughout the celebrations with mindful choices and simple adjustments." - Tanya Khanna, Nutritionist and Yoga Trainer at Alyve Health.

This festive season, small adjustments can make a significant difference in managing blood sugar levels and enjoying the celebrations healthily.

item.title: The Impact Of Winter Inactivity On Digestion And Stomach Cancer Recovery - News18
item.description:
The Impact of Winter Inactivity on Digestion and Stomach Cancer Recovery

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: News18

Winter can significantly slow down digestive processes and hinder recovery for stomach cancer patients due to reduced physical activity and increased inflammation.

  • Stomach cancer patients face additional challenges during winter.
  • Physical inactivity weakens immune function, crucial for recovery.
  • Winter leads to slower metabolism and suboptimal nutritional intake.
  • Regular exercise can improve gut motility and reduce inflammation.
Dr. Neeraj Goel, Director, Oncology Services, states that an inflamed gut creates a negative feedback loop, impacting overall health.

Proactive measures such as regular exercise and a nutrient-rich diet can help mitigate the effects of winter on digestion and recovery.

item.title: 9 Warning Signs Of Pre-Diabetes - India.com
item.description:
9 Warning Signs Of Pre-Diabetes

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 Source: India.com

This article highlights the key warning signs that may indicate pre-diabetes, a serious health condition that can lead to type 2 diabetes if not monitored and managed properly.

  • Dark skin areas in the neck or armpits may signal insulin resistance.
  • Excessive thirst without physical activity can indicate high blood sugar.
  • Increased urination frequency may suggest blood sugar imbalance.
  • Unexplained tiredness could indicate difficulty in processing glucose.
  • Slow healing of cuts and bruises may reflect poor blood sugar control.
  • Unexpected weight changes might be related to blood sugar fluctuations.
  • Blurred vision can occur due to high blood sugar affecting eyesight.
  • Frequent infections can be linked to weakened immunity from high blood sugar.
  • Tingling or numbness in extremities may indicate nerve damage caused by high glucose.

Monitoring these symptoms and consulting with a healthcare professional is crucial for early intervention and management of pre-diabetes.

item.description:
9 Warning Signs Of Pre-Diabetes

item.title: Mpox cases in Africa near 70,000 mark: Africa CDC - Nagaland Post
item.description:
Mpox Cases in Africa Near 70,000 Mark

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Nagaland Post

The number of mpox cases reported in Africa this year has exceeded 69,000 with more than 1,260 deaths. The Africa CDC has highlighted the urgent need for coordinated efforts to combat the outbreak.

The African continent has reported 69,211 mpox cases to date, with 14,794 confirmed and over 1,268 deaths. The current outbreak shows a 789% increase in confirmed cases compared to last year.

  • 69,211 total mpox cases reported.
  • 1,268 deaths attributed to mpox.
  • 3,095 new cases reported last week.
  • 15 countries in Africa experiencing active mpox transmission.
  • 8 priorities outlined to combat the outbreak.
“Countries need to improve data management systems, accelerate vaccination campaigns, and enhance integrated response.” - Ngashi Ngongo, Africa CDC

The Africa CDC has called for collaborative efforts to effectively tackle the mpox epidemic across the continent.

item.title: What triggers Raynaud’s phenomenon during winters and how can you manage it? - The Times of India
item.description:
What triggers Raynaud’s phenomenon during winters and how can you manage it?

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Health News

Raynaud’s phenomenon is a condition that causes the fingers and toes to turn white or blue due to reduced blood flow in response to cold temperatures or stress. This article discusses the triggers during winter and management strategies.

  • Raynaud's is often triggered by cold weather, emotional stress, and smoking.
  • Management includes keeping warm, avoiding extreme temperatures, and lifestyle changes.
  • In severe cases, medications may be necessary to improve blood flow.
"Those with Raynaud’s must take extra precautions in winter to prevent attacks."

Understanding these factors can help individuals better manage their symptoms and improve their quality of life during colder months.

item.title: Heart muscle can regenerate after failure in some patients with artificial hearts: Study - Mathrubhumi English
item.description:
Heart Muscle Can Regenerate After Failure in Some Patients with Artificial Hearts: Study

Published on: IANS

A groundbreaking study has revealed that heart muscle can regenerate in certain patients with artificial hearts, offering new hope for treating and potentially curing heart failure.

  • A subset of patients with artificial hearts demonstrated significant heart muscle regeneration.
  • Heart failure traditionally has no cure, with limited treatment options available.
  • Patients with artificial hearts regenerated heart muscle cells at a rate more than six times higher than healthy individuals.
  • Research emphasizes the need for heart muscle to rest to enhance regenerative capacity.
  • Collaboration between the University of Arizona and the University of Utah was critical to the study.
  • The findings were published in the journal Circulation.
“This is the strongest evidence we have so far that human heart muscle cells can actually regenerate,” said Dr. Sadek.

This discovery could lead to innovative therapies aimed at repairing damaged heart tissue and potentially curing heart failure.

item.title: Men! Improve sperm health with diet and exercise: 7 doctor approved tips you need to know - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Men! Improve Sperm Health with Diet and Exercise: 7 Doctor-Approved Tips You Need to Know

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the decline in sperm health among men aged 25-40 and how lifestyle and environmental factors contribute to this issue.

  • Notable decline in male fertility is noted due to unhealthy lifestyles.
  • Environmental pollution, poor dietary choices, stress, and lack of exercise are key contributors.
  • Doctors recommend consulting fertility specialists for tailored advice.
  • A balanced diet, regular exercise, and stress management are essential for improving sperm quality.
  • Specific dietary recommendations include consuming green leafy vegetables, whole grains, and healthy fats.
Dr. Ankita Kaushal states, “Men should adhere to a healthy diet, regular exercise, stress management techniques such as meditation, and minimize exposure to chemicals.”

Overall, the article emphasizes the importance of a healthy lifestyle to combat declining sperm health and recommends men take proactive steps to improve their fertility.

item.title: Breastfeeding and breast cancer: A natural defense you should know about - India Today
item.description:
Breastfeeding and breast cancer: A natural defense you should know about

Published On: Dec 22, 2024  Source: Indiatoday

Breastfeeding offers powerful health benefits for mothers, including a reduced risk of breast cancer by changing hormonal exposures and breast tissue composition. The longer one breastfeeds, the greater the protective effects, though even short-term breastfeeding can be beneficial.

  • Breastfeeding lowers breast cancer risk through hormonal changes.
  • Self-examinations for breast cancer should be done monthly.
  • Annual mammograms should start at age 30.
  • Lifestyle factors, such as diet and exercise, influence breast cancer risk.
  • Breastfeeding not only benefits the baby but also provides lasting health advantages for mothers.
“Yes, breastfeeding can help reduce the risk of breast cancer. Studies have shown that women who breastfeed have a lower risk of developing breast cancer compared to those who do not.”

In conclusion, breastfeeding emerges not only as a nurturing practice but also as a vital health strategy that can significantly reduce the risk of breast cancer in women.

item.title: 5 healthy flours to keep blood sugar under control - The Times of India
item.description:
5 Healthy Flours to Control Blood Sugar Levels

Publication Date: Available Date

Source: Unknown Source

This article discusses five types of flours that can help regulate blood sugar levels for those with diabetes or at risk of developing it. These alternative flours provide nutritional benefits without leading to significant blood sugar spikes.

  • Almond flour: Low in carbohydrates and high in healthy fats.
  • Coconut flour: High in fiber and low in glycemic index.
  • Oat flour: Contains soluble fiber that helps control blood sugar levels.
  • Chickpea flour: High in protein and helps curb appetite.
  • Brown rice flour: Gluten-free and has a moderate glycemic index.
“Choosing the right flour can greatly impact blood sugar management.”

Incorporating these healthier flour options into your diet may help maintain stable blood sugar levels while enjoying your favorite baked goods.

item.title: 6 natural herbs that help boost immunity in winters - The Times of India
item.description:
6 Natural Herbs to Boost Immunity This Winter

Publication Date: December 20, 2023  |  Source: Health News Daily

As winter approaches, maintaining a strong immune system becomes crucial. This article explores six natural herbs that can enhance immunity during the colder months.

  • Herb #1: Elderberry, known for its antiviral properties.
  • Herb #2: Echinacea, which may help reduce the length of colds.
  • Herb #3: Ginger, effective in combating inflammation.
  • Herb #4: Garlic, a well-known immune booster.
  • Herb #5: Turmeric, revered for its anti-inflammatory benefits.
  • Herb #6: Ashwagandha, which can help manage stress levels.
"Natural herbs provide a holistic approach to strengthen our body's defenses during the winter season." - Dr. Green, herbalist

Incorporating these herbs into your diet can provide a natural way to enhance immune function and maintain health during winter.

item.title: 5th year of Covid-19 and 5 key lessons we’ve learned about building immunity - Health shots
item.description:
5 Key Lessons on Building Immunity After Covid-19: Five Years In

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: Health Shots

The 5th year of the Covid-19 pandemic has highlighted essential lessons about building immunity and prioritizing health. It has illustrated the significance of community health measures and individual responsibility in promoting overall wellness.

  • Immunity is significantly influenced by individual health as well as community efforts.
  • A healthy diet rich in essential nutrients is vital for a robust immune system.
  • Regular exercise plays a crucial role in enhancing immunity.
  • Sufficient sleep and effective stress management contribute greatly to immune health.
  • Good hygiene practices and timely vaccinations are necessary to prevent infections.
“Building our immunity and keeping away from infections is something that the pandemic taught us and these life lessons go a long way in keeping us healthy.”

In conclusion, as we move into the fifth year of navigating the challenges of Covid-19, it is clear that the lessons learned about immunity and health are invaluable for our future.

item.title: 10 diet practices to control cholesterol level - The Times of India
item.description:
10 Diet Practices to Control Cholesterol Levels

Publication Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Times of India

Maintaining cholesterol levels is key to reducing heart disease and stroke. A healthy level of cholesterol aids in good blood flow, preserves arteries and helps ensure long-term cardiovascular health. Here is how you can control cholesterol through diet.

  • Consume healthy vegetable oils like canola, sunflower, or safflower.
  • Fresh fruits and vegetables are low in calories and rich in antioxidants and fiber.
  • Avoid alcohol consumption and smoking to protect heart health.
  • Incorporate cholesterol-lowering spices such as turmeric, garlic, and ginger.
  • Replace red meat with fat-free proteins, including fish and legumes.
  • Consume 25 grams of soy protein daily to potentially lower LDL cholesterol.
  • Include foods fortified with plant sterols and stanols in your diet.
  • Eat more whole grains like brown rice and quinoa for essential nutrients and fiber.
  • Incorporate fatty fish into your diet to provide omega-3s, reducing triglycerides.
"Maintaining cholesterol levels is key to reducing heart disease and stroke."

This article emphasizes the importance of dietary choices in controlling cholesterol levels, thereby supporting cardiovascular health.

item.title: 10 Anti-inflammatory food must be added to your diet - DNA India
item.description:
10 Anti-inflammatory Foods to Add to Your Diet

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: DNA

This article discusses ten essential anti-inflammatory foods that can help improve health by reducing inflammation in the body.

  • Vegetables like broccoli, cauliflower, Brussels sprouts, cabbage, arugula, and kale are rich in sulforaphane.
  • Leafy green vegetables are packed with vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.
  • Tomatoes are a great source of lycopene.
  • Berries such as blueberries, strawberries, and raspberries offer cellular protection.
  • Turmeric contains curcumin, known for its anti-inflammatory properties.
  • Nuts and seeds provide omega-3 fatty acids and are beneficial for gut health.
  • Olive oil is rich in monounsaturated fats and helps improve heart health.
  • Green tea contains catechins, reducing inflammation.
  • Fatty fish like salmon and mackerel are rich in omega-3s.
  • Dark chocolate with a high cocoa content has antioxidant properties.
"This article provides generic information only and is not DNA's opinion."

Incorporating these anti-inflammatory foods into your daily diet can significantly enhance your overall health and well-being.
